Title: yep
Review: It's an easy job. Just drive around with groceries, and you can successfully get a good tip if you get it to the customer's house on time. Would recommend.

Title: Patients
Review: Can make anywhere from 10$-100$ a day if you are patient. Spend most of my time waiting in the parking lot for an order. Its good if you need a little cash on the side

Title: Well I like driving around and making deliveries on time to customers.
Review: What is the best part of working at the company? Flexible hours doing batch orders.   What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Waiting on next job too much lag time.   What is the work environment and culture like at the company? At the moment business is overrun with drivers hard to get orders.   What is a typical day like for you at the company? Right now maybe two or three orders

Title: No sirven para resolver problemas
Review: Me cancelaron la cuenta sin motivo alguno y nunca más la pude recuperar

Title: Easy, get to work your own hours.
Review: Being a delivery driver is easy and can be rewarding. Especially when you deliver to elderly or disabled customers. I enjoy it. It’s just rough on your vehicle with all the driving.

Title: Bots
Review: Myrtle beach zone is a great area. Unfortunately for the past month to 2 months there have been spanish drivers with florida license plates come here and get all the orders. If they are there you will not get an offer and if you do it won't be a good one. Spark and walmart do not care. We are all reporting them and nothing is getting done.

Title: Driver for deliveries
Review: Spark uses to be good. The pay is low and a lot of drivers have multiple phones.  They also use one car with multiple people in it when it's only supposed to be one person.

Title: Walmart does not value drivers
Review: Walmart skims tips off of drivers, driver support is rarely helpful, orders can take up to 1.5 hours to come out to car. The customers are allowed to completely remove tip up to 24 hours after delivery.

Title: Job has it's ups and downs
Review: I love my job however you have to rely on getting order's to make money and if it's not busy or if there's a lot of other spark driver's waiting then unfortunately you just sit for hour's with no order's and no money in your pocket

Title: Contract Driver
Review: Spark has inconsistent work availability. Some days their are alot of offers & other days you may not have any offers for hours leaving you feeling like the day was just wasted time. This position should be treated as a side gig unless you are in a very high demand area. Their are no health benefits nor vehichle discounts. Working closely with Wal-Mart & Sam's Club, one might think a driver would at least receive routine car maintenance discounts, sadly though you don't. If you meet their meteric scores, the driver receives one month of Wal-Mart Plus Membership which in turn gets you 10 cents off at Murphy Gas locations. In my opinion, that is not enough. As a contract driver you are literally putting your life on the line everyday to see that customers receive their purchases however I feel completely unseen & cared for as an "employee". The flexibility & customer interactions are the only reasons I continue working on their platform.

Title: Independence and choice
Review: Loved being able to work independently, choosing which orders I wanted to accept, and stay in my local area.  The app had quirks sometimes but mostly good.  Was making decent money too until out of the blue my account was locked and like 3 weeks later they finally said it was because "a store or customer didn't receive their order" and that was it.  I don't know why - could have been stolen, customer lied, or may have been my mistake delivering to wrong house since the app wouldn't always pass the right address to Google Maps (need a GPS app to navigate to delivery location).

Title: Not enough hours
Review: Flexible schedule but not enough hours and low pay. It’s a lot of wear and tear on your vehicle. Also not enough orders to make up for the amount of stress that you’re putting on your vehicle.

Title: Good money
Review: Good money, easy to get offers. There are almost daily incentives. There are several locations within my area to choose from to do pickup and deliveries!

Title: Not worth you time and you will run your car to the ground
Review: What is the best part of working at the company? It's doesn't pay at all. Unless you stay out all day from sunrise to sunset   What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Getting the orders that come out.  And the pay suck   What is the work environment and culture like at the company? They don't have one. If you like to sit and watch people thats what you will do all day   What is a typical day like for you at the company? Sitting and watching people  all day that walmart. Waiting for orders

Title: To much waiting for offers
Review: Long wait time.  App issues.   Tip baiting.  You can be in the right and still have the blame on you.   It's good for little side money.  Not a full time job

Title: Flexible and decent pay, but no support.
Review: The best part about the job is the flexibility it affords you, that makes it very family friendly. I can even take my 5 year old son with me on occasion when he wants to go. The job isn't difficult at all and there isn't really any pressure.    At first glance, the pay is decent. I make on average about $1200 a week. That looks great, until you understand that taxes haven't been take out, so you have to pay those. Also, gas and vehicle maintenance are a huge expense.   The only major complaint I have is support, there isn't any. They used to be really good at providing support and helping if you had any issues, but that's changed. When you call support, you get multiple recorded messages telling you everything that support will no longer help you with and telling you that you should be able so solve most of the issues on your own. And when you do get an agent, they just say they can't help. I have to call back repeatedly, getting a different agent each time, until I luck up and find one that can help me.  Overall, not bad and you can earn a decent wage if you are willing to work a lot of hours. Just no there isn't much backend support if you have any issues.

Title: Good Side Job
Review: Good side job but pay fluctuates as expected. Most customers are friendly. Walmart Spark works to update their app frequently to make the process easier for drivers.

Title: High competitive compensation. Poor deactivation and appeal policy.
Review: It’s a great gig and the highest compensation out of any other gig app I have used. Downside is that you can with no warning be deactivated. Chances to appeal are 99% NEVER happening, so you’re screwed is this was your primary income.

Title: It’s great in the beginning, but don’t get used to it
Review: When I first started driving for Spark it was amazing! I could make anywhere from $500-$800 weekly in a small town. A year or so later, it’s almost impossible to get a decent run because apparently bots have taken over and they are getting 90% of the decent orders while others such as myself sit in the Walmart parking lot just waiting. IF you’re lucky, you may get an order for $10 and have 4 stops and no tips. And the pickup and delivery managers can be rude and quick to have you deactivated for almost nothing at all. If you are just starting, good luck. You’re going to need it.

Title: Decent part time job
Review: A typical day is waiting around for a delivery. Mourning and afternoons are the pest time to spark. My only complaint is the app doesn’t always work.  This is a ok part time job to make some side money.

Title: yep
Review: It's an easy job. Just drive around with groceries, and you can successfully get a good tip if you get it to the customer's house on time. Would recommend.

Title: Patients

Right now maybe two or three orders

Title: Independence and choice
Review: Loved being able to work independently, choosing which orders I wanted to accept, and stay in my local area.  The app had quirks sometimes but mostly good.  Was making decent money too until out of the blue my account was locked and like 3 weeks later they finally said it was because "a store or customer didn't receive their order" and that was it.  I don't know why - could have been stolen, customer lied, or may have been my mistake delivering to wrong house since the app wouldn't always pass the right address to Google Maps (need a GPS app to navigate to delivery location).

Title: Not enough hours
Review: Flexible schedule but not enough hours and low pay. It’s a lot of wear and tear on your vehicle. Also not enough orders to make up for the amount of stress that you’re putting on your vehicle.

Title: Good money
Review: Good money, easy to get offers. There are almost daily incentives. There are several locations within my area to choose from to do pickup and deliveries!

Title: Not worth you time and you will run your car to the ground
Review: What is the best part of working at the company? It's doesn't pay at all. Unless you stay out all day from sunrise to sunset   What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Getting the orders that come out.  And the pay suck   What is the work environment and culture like at the company? They don't have one. If you like to sit and watch people thats what you will do all day   What is a typical day like for you at the company? Sitting and watching people  all day that walmart. Waiting for orders

Title: To much waiting for offers
Review: Long wait time.  App issues.   Tip baiting.  You can be in the right and still have the blame on you.   It's good for little side money.  Not a full time job

Title: Flexible and decent pay, but no support.
Review: The best part about the job is the flexibility it affords you, that makes it very family friendly. I can even take my 5 year old son with me on occasion when he wants to go. The job isn't difficult at all and there isn't really any pressure.    At first glance, the pay is decent. I make on average about $1200 a week. That looks great, until you understand that taxes haven't been take out, so you have to pay those. Also, gas and vehicle maintenance are a huge expense.   The only major complaint I have is support, there isn't any. They used to be really good at providing support and helping if you had any issues, but that's changed. When you call support, you get multiple recorded messages telling you everything that support will no longer help you with and telling you that you should be able so solve most of the issues on your own. And when you do get an agent, they just say they can't help. I have to call back repeatedly, getting a different agent each time, until I luck up and find one that can help me.  Overall, not bad and you can earn a decent wage if you are willing to work a lot of hours. Just no there isn't much backend support if you have any issues.

Title: Good Side Job
Review: Good side job but pay fluctuates as expected. Most customers are friendly. Walmart Spark works to update their app frequently to make the process easier for drivers.

Title: High competitive compensation. Poor deactivation and appeal policy.
Review: It’s a great gig and the highest compensation out of any other gig app I have used. Downside is that you can with no warning be deactivated. Chances to appeal are 99% NEVER happening, so you’re screwed is this was your primary income.

Title: It’s great in the beginning, but don’t get used to it
Review: When I first started driving for Spark it was amazing! I could make anywhere from $500-$800 weekly in a small town. A year or so later, it’s almost impossible to get a decent run because apparently bots have taken over and they are getting 90% of the decent orders while others such as myself sit in the Walmart parking lot just waiting. IF you’re lucky, you may get an order for $10 and have 4 stops and no tips. And the pickup and delivery managers can be rude and quick to have you deactivated for almost nothing at all. If you are just starting, good luck. You’re going to need it.

Title: Decent part time job
Review: A typical day is waiting around for a delivery. Mourning and afternoons are the pest time to spark. My only complaint is the app doesn’t always work.  This is a ok part time job to make some side money.

Title: yep
Review: It's an easy job. Just drive around with groceries, and you can successfully get a good tip if you get it to the customer's house on time. Would recommend.

Title: Patients
Review: Can make anywhere from 10$-100$ a day if you are patient. Spend most of my time waiting in the parking lot for an order. Its good if you need a little cash on the side

Title: Well I like driving around and making deliveries on time to customers.
Review: What is the best part of working at the company? Flexible hours doing batch orders.   What is the most stressful part about working at the company? Waiting on next job too much lag time.   What is the work environment and culture like at the company? At the moment business is overrun with drivers hard to get orders.   What is a typical day like for you at the company? Right now maybe two or three orders

Title: No sirven para resolver problemas
Review: Me cancelaron la cuenta sin motivo alguno y nunca más la pude recuperar

Title: Easy, get to work your own hours.
Review: Being a delivery driver is easy and can be rewarding. Especially when you deliver to elderly or disabled customers. I enjoy it. It’s just rough on your vehicle with all the driving.

Title: Bots
Review: Myrtle beach zone is a great area. Unfortunately for the past month to 2 months there have been spanish drivers with florida license plates come here and get all the orders. If they are there you will not get an offer and if you do it won't be a good one. Spark and walmart do not care. We are all reporting them and nothing is getting done.

Title: Driver for deliveries
Review: Spark uses to be good. The pay is low and a lot of drivers have multiple phones.  They also use one car with multiple people in it when it's only supposed to be one person.

Title: Walmart does not value drivers
Review: Walmart skims tips off of drivers, driver support is rarely helpful, orders can take up to 1.5 hours to come out to car. The customers are allowed to completely remove tip up to 24 hours after delivery.

Title: Job has it's ups and downs
Review: I love my job however you have to rely on getting order's to make money and if it's not busy or if there's a lot of other spark driver's waiting then unfortunately you just sit for hour's with no order's and no money in your pocket

Title: Contract Driver
Review: Spark has inconsistent work availability. Some days their are alot of offers & other days you may not have any offers for hours leaving you feeling like the day was just wasted time. This position should be treated as a side gig unless you are in a very high demand area. Their are no health benefits nor vehichle discounts. Working closely with Wal-Mart & Sam's Club, one might think a driver would at least receive routine car maintenance discounts, sadly though you don't. If you meet their meteric scores, the driver receives one month of Wal-Mart Plus Membership which in turn gets you 10 cents off at Murphy Gas locations. In my opinion, that is not enough. As a contract driver you are literally putting your life on the line everyday to see that customers receive their purchases however I feel completely unseen & cared for as an "employee". The flexibility & customer interactions are the only reasons I continue working on their platform.

Was making decent money too until out of the blue my account was locked and like 3 weeks later they finally said it was because "a store or customer didn't receive their order" and that was it. Review: Good side job but pay fluctuates as expected. Most customers are friendly. Walmart Spark works to update their app frequently to make the process easier for drivers.

Title: High competitive compensation. Poor deactivation and appeal policy.
Review: It’s a great gig and the highest compensation out of any other gig app I have used. Downside is that you can with no warning be deactivated. Chances to appeal are 99% NEVER happening, so you’re screwed is this was your primary income.

Title: It’s great in the beginning, but don’t get used to it
Review: When I first started driving for Spark it was amazing! I could make anywhere from $500-$800 weekly in a small town. A year or so later, it’s almost impossible to get a decent run because apparently bots have taken over and they are getting 90% of the decent orders while others such as myself sit in the Walmart parking lot just waiting. IF you’re lucky, you may get an order for $10 and have 4 stops and no tips. And the pickup and delivery managers can be rude and quick to have you deactivated for almost nothing at all. If you are just starting, good luck. You’re going to need it.

Title: Decent part time job
Review: A typical day is waiting around for a delivery. Mourning and afternoons are the pest time to spark. My only complaint is the app doesn’t always work.  This is a ok part time job to make some side money.
